title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Thursday 22 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: three arrested over boy 's circumcision in nottingham .
kedleston hall housing plans overturned by high court .

documents.title: unlawful burial charges after body find
text: unlawful burial charges after body find

documents.title: residents 'triumph ' over homes developer
text: residents 'triumph ' over homes developer

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates have now finished for the day but some local news will still appear on the page through the evening and overnight .
we will be back at 08:00 on friday with more news , sport , weather and travel from across the east midlands .

documents.title: east midlands weather update : some clouds and clearer spells
text: expect high pollen counts this evening and into tomorrow .
this evening will see some clouds and clearer spells in the early hours with lows of 13c ( 55f ) .
tomorrow will be cloudy and breezy with some rain in the morning but this should clear - leaving some drier and brighter spells in the afternoon .
temperatures will reach highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: west bridgford homes with external mail boxes targeted by fraudsters
text: nottinghamshire police has issued a warning - after some homes in west bridgford with external mail boxes were targeted by fraudsters .
it is believed offenders obtained personal details and made fraudulent applications for credit cards .
police said they then intercepted the deliveries by filling the mail boxes with newspapers .

this meant that when the post is delivered , it sits on top of the newspapers , allowing the mail to be easily retrived by criminals thought to have been following royal mail staff as they conduct their deliveries .
two men , aged 48 and 33 , have been arrested on sus of stealing mail on tuesday and have since been released pending further enquiries .
police have advised those with external mail boxes to empty them regularly .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man denies railway station murder
text: man denies railway station murder

documents.title: three-vehicle crash blocks derby road
text: # raynesway in # derby is blocked due to a road traffic collision involving three vehicles .
please use alternative routes where possible .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charity walk held in mansfield to raise awareness of social exclusion
text: about 200 people came together for a walk in mansfield to raise awareness of social exclusion .
it was organised by the nottingham branch of national charity mencap as part of learning disability week .
volunteers and service users from reach learning disability and nottinghamshire victim care also took part in the one walk event today .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man denies leicester murder
text: a man charged with murdering a man found stabbed outside leicester railway station has pleaded not guilty .
rajesh chhagan khunti is accused of killing 30-year-old dilovan fazil mohammed in march this year .
khunti , also 30 , has been remanded in custody and is due to go on trial at nottingham crown court in august .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jury discharged in manslaughter trial
text: the judge in charge of a manslaughter trial at derby crown court has discharged the jury .
richard last , 31 , of bridgeside way , spondon , had pleaded not guilty to the manslaughter of 22-year-old oliver falivena ( below ) .
mr falivena died after suffering head injuries in derby market place last august .
the court has said it is unable to give out any further information at this stage .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police concerned for missing woman thought to be in the workington area
text: police are concerned for the welfare of a 38-year-old woman .
donna jennings is from derbyshire but it is believed she is in the workington area .
she was last seen on walker road , workington , after being dropped off by a taxi late yesterday evening .
it is thought that she could be wearing leggings and a loose jacket .

documents.title: camara leaves derby by mutual consent
text: camara leaves derby by mutual consent

documents.title: in shoppers evacuate the highcross shopping centre
text: this was the scene earlier today when shoppers were told to evacuate the highcross shopping centre in leicester following a fire alert .
the centre has now reopened .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kedleston hall housing plans overturned by high court
text: plans for up to 400 new homes close to derbyshire 's grade i listed kedleston hall have been overturned by the high court .
the hall is recognised as `` one of the finest examples of 18th century architecture anywhere '' , the court was told .
catesby estates limited has been pushing to build new homes on kedleston and memorial roads , 1.7 miles from the hall .
despite the need for more housing in the area , amber valley borough council refused planning permission for the scheme .
catesby estates appealed and a government planning inspector granted outline consent after a public inquiry .
he said the development would not be visible from the hall and therefore did not form part of its setting .
concerned residents campaigned against the decision and were today handed victory .
the court heard historic england , the national trust and the gardens trust had all objected to the development as well .

mrs justice lang said the inspector had failed to focus on the `` historic , social and economic connections '' between the hall and the development site , which once formed part of its sprawling agricultural estate .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: adams takes under-18 job in non-league
text: adams takes under-18 job in non-league

documents.title: woman injured in nottingham crash
text: police have confirmed the crash on king street/queen street in nottingham involved a car and a cyclist .
a woman has been taken to the queen 's medical centre with injuries that are not thought to be life-threatening .
the roads are still closed with no indication as to when they will reopen .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham tower blocks not using grenfell tower cladding
text: tower blocks across the uk are being examined after the london fire .
about 600 high rises in the country are using similar cladding to grenfell tower , downing street estimates .
but nottingham city homes has confirmed all 13 of their tower blocks do not use the same cladding .
none of the @ twitterid 13 high rises are clad in the same material as # grenfelltower
but are they equipped with modern & effective fire safety precautions & residents informed of their location & operation
@ twitterid pls visit @ twitterid website for resident info on fire safety on blocks .
follow homepage link at
but do these towers have sprinkler systems and working fire alarms ?
when was these alarms tested ?
some have sprinkler systems , all have alarms .
all have regular fire risk assessments .
alarms are tested weekly .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roads closed after city centre crash
text: police have closed king street and queen street in nottingham following what looks to be a crash behind the brian clough statue .
a cyclist has been seen receiving medical treatment .
more on this as we get it .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby-made crossrail train takes to the tracks
text: passengers have been given their first chance to travel on one of these new trains built by derby-based bombardier
eventually there will be 66 of the trains running on london 's new elizabeth line .
joe bednall , from bombardier transportation , told the bbc he feels `` over the moon '' to have the first train finished and on the tracks in `` record time '' .
he said the £ 1bn contract for the crossrail project has provided hundreds of engineering and manufacturing jobs in derby and worldwide .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing man found in normanton
text: police have said maurice smith has been found safe and well in normanton this afternoon .
the 83-year-old had been missing from his home in spondon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london fire : derby city council opens book of condolence
text: a book of condolence has opened at derby city council to pay respect to the victims of the grenfell tower fire .
people can sign the book at the council 's reception .
to lose everything you own , a friend or a family member in a tragedy like this is too awful to comprehend .
the residents of derby send their deepest sympathies and messages of support to anyone who has been touched by this terrible disaster . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tour of britain : event could give nottinghamshire £ 500,000 boost
text: nottinghamshire could be in line for a £ 500,000 boost when the tour of britain event passes through the county in september , according to tourism body visit nottinghamshire .
at least 200,000 spectators are expected to turn out for stage four of the event , which begins in mansfield and ends in newark .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire alert sees highcross shopping centre evacuated
text: hundreds of shoppers were evacuated from the highcross shopping centre in leicester in response to a fire alert .
the centre said the situation has been `` resolved '' and it has now reopened .
a centre spokesman added that `` customer safety is our number one priority '' .
highcross was temporarily evacuated in response to a fire alert .
this was resolved and the centre has now reopened 1/2
makes sense .
i could smell slight burning smell as i left the building via the cordoned off area .
thanks for the update .
@ twitterid
2/2 customer safety is our number one priority
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'phenomenal ' award-winning buildings
text: 'phenomenal ' award-winning buildings

documents.title: emergency services at crash on busy nottingham road
text: drivers are being urged to avoid a busy nottingham road following a crash .
nottinghamshire fire and rescue service said two crews from stockhill and london road have been sent to gregory boulevard after the collision .
the service added it was at the scene with nottinghamshire police and east midlands ambulance service .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prestigious award for richard iii architects
text: leicester cathedral was one of the winners in the 2017 royal institute of british architects ( riba ) awards .
the award was for their richard iii project , `` with dignity and honour '' .
architects were originally appointed in 2008 to redesign the cathedral 's interior - but those plans had to be altered when the remains of richard iii were found under a nearby car park .
a memorial and tomb had to be incorporated .
riba praised van heyningen ( vhh ) and haward architects ' design of the new altar and the king 's tomb behind it .
architect josh mccosh also won the riba east midlands project architect of the year award for his work on the project .

the relationships formed with josh and his team at vhh were integral to the success of the project , so we are thrilled that this award recognises the excellence of the design and craftsmanship involved . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham forest 's historic city ground protected
text: nottingham forest 's historic city ground stadium has been designated a `` community asset '' , meaning fans have an influence on the ground 's future .
the nottingham forest supporters trust ( nfst ) has successfully applied to register the ground as an asset of community value .
elliott stanley , the chair of nfst , said fans and the local community can help safeguard the club .
he said : `` the city ground is undoubtedly one of the most iconic grounds in the footballing world and it holds so many special memories for so many fans .

`` the ground being formally registered an asset of community value is something that we set out to secure , not only because it aligns with our vision of safeguarding the future of the club , but perhaps more crucially , it ensures that fans have a voice on that future . ''
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: mansfield mp clarifies comments after 'grey backlash '
text: mansfield 's new conservative mp ben bradley has clarified comments he made to bbc newsbeat following a backlash on social media yesterday .
mr bradley told bbc newsbeat older politicians have `` no idea '' .
`` my frustration has always been with some 60-year-old grey bloke talking about things that are going to affect people who are 18 to 24 , '' he said .
but his comments were not universally welcomed on our facebook page .
angie holden wrote : `` careful ben , there is a lot of us sixťy somethings that voted for you ! ''

in response , mr bradley said : `` it 's taken a bit out of context angie , when i said that we were specifically talking about the conservatives doing more to engage with younger people , and i said it was important that younger people had an input in to the policies that will directly affect them - not just the `` sixty years old grey blokes '' . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager brereton signs new forest deal
text: teenager brereton signs new forest deal

documents.title: dry weather means water courses 'lower than usual '
text: it 's gone a bit grey and , mercifully , a little cooler than recent days here in the east midlands .
but due to the unusually dry conditions , we 've had some advice from the environment agency and severn trent .
following a dry winter and spring , some rivers , groundwaters and reservoirs are lower than normal for the time of year , '' an environment agency spokesman said .
it 's working with water companies , businesses and farmers to minimise the potential impacts to people and the environment should the dry weather continue .
the spokesman added : we always advise that everyone uses water wisely - especially during a period of dry weather . ''
severn trent said it 's seeing a higher than usual demand on water but things are currently `` fine '' .
the water firm , which supplies most of the region , said people should take some precautions to preserve water , including :
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: twycross zoo welcomes baby orangutan
text: oh my gosh cute alert !
this baby orangutan has been born at twycross zoo .
kibriah 's new arrival means this is the second orangutan baby to be born at the zoo this year .
in march , mother maliku gave birth to a baby boy .
kibriah 's birth last friday was a special moment for all of us and it was fantastic to see how her experience with previous babies meant that we did not need to step in .
our orangutans are going to keep us very busy with two new babies growing up together , but it is something we all look forward to . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: transfer gossip : foxes after nigerian striker
text: leicester city boss craig shakespeare is plotting a £ 25million move for manchester city striker kelechi iheanacho as the foxes prepare to spend big this summer .
author: The Daily Telegraph

documents.title: burst pipes and discoloured water in nottinghamshire and leicestershire
text: severn trent water says it is dealing with two burst pipes and reports of discoloured water in nottinghamshire and leicestershire .
engineers are currently fixing burst water pipes in woodgate lane in cotgrave , nottinghamshire , and keyham lane east , in scraptoft , leicester .
this may cause water supplies in the ng12 and le7 areas to be off or at low pressure for some customers .
meanwhile , the water company says it has received reports of discoloured water in the birstall and wanlip area of leicester .
severn trent says the reason for this could be a result of the way they 've moved water around the network `` to meet the high demand we 've been experiencing '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london fire : fire service asked to identify 'at risk buildings '
text: derbyshire fire and rescue service has been asked to identify buildings which might be at risk following the grenfell tower fire .
the service confirmed it is in contact with hospitals and educational establishments as part of its work .
the county 's only high-rise residential building is rivermead house in derby .
it had an in-date fire inspection but it 's been refreshed in the last week .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: muslim festival in nottingham will raise funds for camps in calais
text: a woman from nottingham , who regularly volunteers at camps in calais , is holding a fundraiser to coincide with a religious celebration .
sahira kauser is hosting chand raat , which is a small celebration held on the eve of the eid festival celebrated by muslims .
but sahira will be donating some of the money from the fundraiser to calais refugee aid .
she said : `` it 's a charity close to my heart .
`` they collect food , clothes and medical aid to send to countries where there are many displaced people , many of whom live in ditches . ''
the event , which is open to everyone , will be held on saturday at the excelsior suites , nottingham , from 18:00 bst .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sykes leave leics by mutual consent
text: sykes leave leics by mutual consent

documents.title: leicester charity workers helped grenfell tower victims
text: it 's been over a week since we saw the shocking images of the fire at grenfell tower in london .
a lot of us probably questioned how we as individuals could help , but two people from leicester actually did .
gul zada and joe thurgate work for the british red cross and were deployed to the capital to support residents at the community assistance centre .
when people arrived at the centre , i signed them in and took them into the centre to colleagues who provided specialist advice and support .
the circumstances were tough but the residents and their families were lovely , friendly people .
the community is strong and positive . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shortlist for leicestershire green plaque awards announced
text: a shortlist has been announced for the next round of the green plaque awards scheme in leicestershire .
among the list of 12 people and places is george fox from fenny drayton .
he was the founder of the quaker movement .
you can see information on all of those shortlisted here .
leicestershire county council wants you to vote for your top six on the list .
the six with the most votes will then get a green plaque .
among those that have already received a green plaque in the county is the loughborough racehorse sunloch
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concern for missing 83-year-old spondon man
text: an 83-year-old man has gone missing from his home in spondon , derbyshire police has said .
maurice smith left his home in a silver vauxhall corsa , registration sa06 fxe .
it has recently been found parked on stenson road in stenson fields .
officers are asking people in stenson fields to check their back gardens , garages , sheds and outbuildings for any sign of mr smith .
mr smith is described as white , slim , 5ft 10ins tall with grey hair and police have said he is `` vulnerable '' .
at the time of his disappearance , he was wearing a green jacket with a light blue check shirt and jeans .
a derbyshire police spokesman added : `` maurice 's health is our primary concern and we do n't believe he is able to find his own way home . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : joe davis & sam hornby join port vale
text: league two side port vale have re-signed ex-valiants defender joe davis from fleetwood on a two-year deal .
the 23-year-old has negotiated his release from league one fleetwood , where he was still under contract .
they have also signed burton albion goalkeeper sam hornby , 22 , also on a two-year deal - the second keeper to move to vale park in as many days .
hornby , who was offered a new deal to stay with the brewers , is yet to make his football league debut .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: simpson not ready for club return
text: simpson not ready for club return

documents.title: next falls down leicestershire 's 'rich list '
text: the clothing and homeware retailer next is no longer leicestershire 's highest earning business .
the enderby-based company has fallen into third place , with property developers barratt homes and car dealers sytner group taking the top two spots .
in 2015 , shares in next rose to £ 80 but since then they 've halved .
nas harrison , a business and marketing lecturer at de montfort university , told the bbc many shoppers are now choosing cheaper brands .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university announces £ 200m of funding for research
text: the university of nottingham has announced £ 200m of funding for research that could create about 500 jobs locally .
six different projects will examine issues such as modern day slavery , greener transport and sustainable food supplies .
professor david salt will head up the future food group analysing how crops can grow in hotter climates .
he said : `` we are now approaching an era where our climate is less predictable so what we need to do is develop plants which can actually cope with variability . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: three arrested over boy 's circumcision in nottingham
text: three people have been arrested by police investigating the circumcision of a three-month-old boy .
a 61-year-old man , believed to be the doctor who carried out the procedure , has been arrested on sus of grievous bodily harm with intent .
the boy 's mother complained to police saying her son was circumcised without her consent while staying with his paternal grandparents , in july 2013 .
a 44-year-old man and a woman , 47 , have also been arrested .
nottinghamshire police said they were arrested on sus of conspiracy to commit grievous bodily harm .
all three people have been released pending further investigation .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : fancy a deep fried ice cream ?
text: we 've heard of battered mars bars and battered creme eggs and it would appear the fry 's the limit - with the george 's tradition fish and chip shop in chellaston experimenting with deep fried ice cream for the summer
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: plans to build ashbourne bypass 'progressing '
text: plans to build a new road around ashbourne are progressing despite the pressure of getting extra funding .
seven years ago , a north/south bypass around ashbourne , relieving pressure on the a515 , was costed at between £ 6m and £ 8m .

now derbyshire county council says the bill is likely to be north of £ 15m , and as hard as it will be to squeeze the money out of the government , the council says it will be even harder if they 've done no planning .
they want to start that , bringing in consultants to outline possible routes .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: car overturns in bingham
text: a spokesman for bingham fire station has said firefighters were called to fairfield street after a car overturned yesterday .
the station added no-one was seriously injured .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man taken to hospital with 'self-inflicted ' injuries
text: a section of railway terrace in derby has been cordoned off this morning
police have told the bbc it follows a report of an injured man near the railway station around 01:00 bst .
the man was taken to hospital - it 's thought his injuries may be self-inflicted .
police said they are maintaining a scene while they investigate what happened .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager 's death in mansfield 'no longer murder '
text: the death of a teenage girl - which was initially being investigated as murder - is no longer being treated as sus police have said .
the 17-year-old 's body was found at a house on foston close , mansfield , at 01:45 bst on wednesday , after concerns were raised about her safety .
a 21-year-old man was arrested on sus of murder , but has since been released and is now assisting officers .
detectives are not looking for anyone else in connection to the death .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police now treating new parks death as sus
text: police have confirmed they are now treating the death of a 60-year-old man found at a house in new parks in leicester as sus
the body of peter west was found at a property in glazebrook road on tuesday .
a 35-year-old woman and a 35-year-old man - who were arrested on sus of preventing the lawful and decent burial of a dead body - have since been rearrested on sus of manslaughter .
police are appealing to members of the public that knew mr west and visited his home in the last few weeks for information .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing leicester man found in london
text: leicestershire police has confirmed missing leicester man omar bojang has been found safe and well .
he was located in london last night .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

text: travel : updates from across the region
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

text: here 's how it 's looking today

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
